data.title: good for a quick lunch for for a group wanting average/good quality and space to gather
data.text: i worked close by and would swing in for lunch.  Always quick and efficient service.  soup, won ton with sweet and sour sauce served, sometimes a little salad.   You can eat a healthy plate - sometimes too much for $10.   soups are great when you have a cold.

data.title: Good lunch spot
data.text: The food was good and for locals looking for quick service and reliable quality this is the place.  I will definitely be back.

data.title: Chinese
data.text: Food is consistent.  Plenty of choices.  Beer and wine served.  Wait staff is good and the food comes out quickly.

data.title: Average Chinese food for American Chinese Cuisine
data.text: I have only been there for lunch and it is OK Chinese food for the American palate. The lunch specials are reasonable and the food is just OK.

data.title: A surprised cantonese cooking in San Ramon
data.text: Very good/authentic Cantonese cooking being in the east bay and not the peninsula or San Francisco.  Very comparable to Cooking Papa in Foster City.  I love the beef stew but small portion.  Other than that, this place is very good.

data.title: Nice family restaurant
data.text:
Good soups.
We also have done lots of take out from hear, Quick service, the fish dishes are nice as well as the soups

data.title: Our favorite local spot for Chinese food
data.text: We often get our take out from this place.  It's close to our home and has good quality food.  When we eat in the restaurant we find the service to be very good.

data.title: A very good lunch at Three Brothers!
data.text:
The lunch menu offers extensive variety in main dishes!  The lunch special includes an appetizer (fried won tons and sauce), soup (the soup of the day was hot and sour soup the day we were there); pork fried rice and the entree of your choice; followed by fortune cookies.

Service was very fast; they bring water in a bottle and a pot of hot tea to the table when you are seated; along with the appetizer.  Soup was served promptly after we ordered and our entrees were served within 10 minutes!  The quantity of food with the lunch specials is more than ample and at $8 to $12 per lunch (price varies by choice of entree); it is a very good value!  I had kung pao chicken, my husband enjoyed a spicy beef dish with zucchini; both lunches were very good!

They also do a brisk take out business!

data.title: Great service!
data.text:
Really good food.  Authentic flavors.  

Pots tickers are pan fried.  Honey walnut shrimp is really tastey.  Double mushroom chicken (ask for spicey) is really great.

Water is served in wine bottles - fun!

Service is great here.

A little spendy, but worth it.

data.title: Jellyfish anyone?
data.text: Judging by the type of food and the mostly Chinese clientele it was an fairly authentic Chinese restaurant. The jellyfish was ok but nothing I would ever order again. The duck was fine, the skin crispy and the pieces of meat  tasty. We had a whole baked fish, fried rice, various vegetable dishes, deep fried crab in the shell, scallop and beef, and soup. All the dishes were cooked in a lot of oil. I did not feel well afterwards.

data.title: IF YOU DON'T SPEAK CHINESE YOU MAY BE IN TROUBLE!
data.text: Our waiter was very hard to understand and when we asked questions we don't know what he answered. We wanted separate meals, not family meals, but they brought everything to share. We asked for separate checks, we got one check all listed in Chinese so we didn't really know who owed what. The food was mediocre. I've had much, much better. One of the meals ordered looked and tasted like slime. I would have sent it back. Not going back there again.

data.title: Great Staff, Good Value
data.text: I came here with a large group of friends. Food was adequate...a bit salty for my taste though flavorful enough. However, prices were very reasonable, and the staff was very friendly.

data.title: Very good Chinese Food in the East Bay!
data.text: Loved the rock cod, fried tofu, chicken fried rice, hot and sour soup. Was craving for good Chinese food and got exactly what I wanted. Thumbs up.

data.title: Ask for the special menu
data.text: I especially enjoy the peking spare ribs, sweet and sour fish and salt and pepper chicken wings.  These are on the special menu that is not provided unless you ask for it.  This menu is for 3 items at about $22.  Also, visit their second location on Contra Costa Blvd in Pleasant Hill.

data.title: 20 years and still going strong!
data.text:
We live local, but hadn't been here for years. Just not on our routine.  That will change after our recent meal.  Service was efficient, though a bit slow on a busy Friday night. When food arrived it was piping hot, and very good.
The Mongolian beef was tasty, with the beef very tender and the sauce flavorful.  The chicken chow mein was just 'ok' - would probably skip it in favor of rice next time. 
The hit of our meal was the special: Asparagus 3 (beef, chicken, shrimp) delicious sauce, crisp vegetables.  
We will be back, especially to try different options on the early bird deals and the walnut prawns
Of note: majority of patrons were Asian, they still have a pot of tea and 
chop sticks on the table. Most Chinese restaurants no longer do this.

data.title: good take-out lunch menu
data.text: these guys have a large and varied take-out lunch menu (11am-3pm) with over 40 items, and they're all priced right! I love the szechuan beef and the mongolian beef. also love the prawns with smooth scramble egg.  also like the lemon chicken, but this dish has been a little inconsistent for me.  the lunch specials are served with your choice of chow mein, pork fried rice or steamed white rice, plus an egg roll and fortune cookie and a cup of the soup du jour (yes. the soup is served on the takeout menu even though the menu states otherwise).

data.title: Service
data.text:
Called to order food for a party that I am hosting...it was like I was wasting His time. By the time I was ordered the 3rd food item he told me to call him back cuz they are too busy! 
Rude!!!

data.title: New Favorite Chinese Restaurant
data.text: Just moved to San Ramon and found this place. Great food, especially the salt and pepper Calamari. Their fried rice is not drenched in soy sauce, very fresh and flavorful. Always has great specials, and provides all of the sauces when I get take out. Great food!

data.title: Awful!!!
data.text: All their dishes taste the same! They must use the same sauce for all their dishes!! I've tried eating there twice, many years apart, and whatever dishes we ordered, they still all tasted the same...The one in Pleasant Hill is much better.

data.title: An old favorite
data.text: This restaurant has been through several iterations as a Chinese place.  The portions are generous and the menu is interesting.  Quality varies depending on who is cooking but it's reasonably priced.
